issues.title: ## Bug Report: Fiber state corruption after `Workflow.timeout` expires on x86_64
issues.author: NielsKSchjoedt
issues.summary: Fiber state corruption occurs on x86_64 Linux when `Workflow.timeout` expires and is immediately followed by `Workflow.execute_activity`, causing a NoMethodError where `Fiber.yield` returns true instead of a Resolution object. The issue does not occur on aarch64 architecture and can be worked around by calling `Workflow.sleep(0)` before the activity.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support non-workflow activities
issues.author: maciejdudko
issues.summary: Feature request to support executing activities outside of workflow context. Workers and clients need to be enhanced to start, manage, and retrieve activity results independently, leveraging new upcoming server APIs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Confirm/assert Ruby 4 compatibility, maybe drop 3.2 support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Update Ruby SDK to confirm/assert compatibility with Ruby 4 and consider dropping support for Ruby 3.2 at end-of-life. Requires updates to CI, documentation, and compatibility testing.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow overriding of the Worker Deployment Version when invoking a Child Workflow
issues.author: chris-olszewski
issues.summary: Users want to override the target deployment version when invoking a child workflow in the Ruby SDK, similar to how it works when creating workflows from a client. This feature would enable pre-deployment testing.

issues.title: Problem: Testing Temporal Workflows with Signals in Ruby SDK Time-Skipping Environment
issues.author: NielsKSchjoedt
issues.summary: User cannot test Temporal Ruby workflows that use `wait_condition` with signals in the time-skipping test environment. The signal is received correctly (verified via query), but the workflow doesn't resume execution after the signal, causing timeouts when trying to get the result.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Disable durable scheduler for all OTel in-workflow calls, not just some
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: OpenTelemetry instrumentation in workflows can become non-deterministic when libraries monkey-patch Context.current, causing issues even though the durable scheduler is supposed to be disabled. The fix is to disable the durable scheduler for all OTel calls, not just the obvious non-deterministic ones.

issues.title: [Bug] Some common uses of ActiveModel fail in workflows due to sync construct use
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: ActiveModel classes fail in workflows because they use ConcurrentMap internally, which relies on Thread::Mutex that is forbidden in workflows. The issue occurs when accessing attributes or using models with ActiveModel::Attributes, causing NondeterminismError.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Enable Worker Heartbeating
issues.author: yuandrew
issues.summary: Feature request to enable worker heartbeating in the Ruby SDK by allowing users to specify the worker heartbeat interval when initializing Core Runtime. Worker heartbeating is already implemented in Core and needs to be exposed through the Ruby SDK.

issues.title: [ruby] Plugin + SimplePlugin
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Implement a Plugin system for the Ruby SDK to allow users to self-serve create integrations with Temporal Workflows, following the pattern already established in the Python SDK.

issues.title: [Bug] Retry policy non_retryable_error_types does not respect error module/namespace
issues.author: laurynas
issues.summary: Retry policy's non_retryable_error_types parameter doesn't match exceptions with module/namespace qualifiers (e.g., ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound). The SDK strips namespaces when converting errors to ApplicationError, causing activities to retry when they should fail instantly.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Ensure fibers and workflow instances are properly GC'd on workflow eviction
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Ruby SDK needs to ensure fibers and workflow instances are properly garbage collected when workflows are evicted. Initial investigation suggested fibers held by threads need explicit cleanup, but recent analysis indicates suspended fibers can be GC'd naturally if all references are removed, though deterministic testing has proven difficult.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Require payload codec from data converter file
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Users should be able to require the payload codec from the data converter file in the Ruby SDK. Currently, the payload codec is not exported when requiring 'temporalio/converters', making it unavailable despite being part of the data converter functionality.

issues.title: [Bug] Potential deadlock detected after upgrade to v0.6.0
issues.author: laurynas
issues.summary: After upgrading to v0.6.0, Ruby SDK workflows deadlock with a 2-second timeout error due to call tracing overhead. The illegal call tracer was causing excessive validation that made workflows slow enough to trigger the deadlock detector.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Ensure gRPC binary metadata headers are supported
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for gRPC binary metadata headers in the Ruby SDK by requiring ASCII-based string values for `-bin` keys and setting them as Tonic metadata binary values.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Reclassify Benign Application errors in OpenTelemetry
issues.author: THardy98
issues.summary: Feature request to reclassify benign application errors in OpenTelemetry spans, following the same approach implemented in the Python SDK. This involves distinguishing between user code exceptions and system errors for better observability.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Switch scheduler ready fiber list from array to queue
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Improve Ruby scheduler memory efficiency by replacing array-based ready fiber list with a proper queue data structure to avoid repeated shift/append operations.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Look into client-side trimming of failures to avoid server-side wrap-and-truncate
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Implement client-side trimming of failure proto to reduce server-side truncation and wrapping. The server currently truncates oversized failures and wraps them in error responses; this feature explores doing size limiting on the client before sending to prevent this behavior, with opt-out support for custom server limits.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Plugin support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add plugin support to the Ruby SDK, referencing a cross-SDK features issue for implementation details.

issues.title: [Bug] ScopedLogger fails attempting to compare symbol to integer for libraries like semantic_logger
issues.author: schoblaska
issues.summary: ScopedLogger fails when comparing log levels against non-integer values like symbols. This occurs when using libraries like semantic_logger that return symbols for Logger#level instead of integers, causing a type comparison error during workflow execution.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add first execution run ID to workflow info
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to add the first execution run ID to workflow info in the Ruby SDK, as part of a cross-SDK feature initiative.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Research and maybe implement disallowing all Ruby stdlib sync constructs in workflows
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to disallow Ruby stdlib synchronization constructs (sleep, Mutex, ConditionVariable, Queue) in workflows before GA. These constructs are fiber-aware and implicitly made durable, but can cause issues when third-party libraries use them unexpectedly, leading to hung workflows.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Error notification
issues.author: fmluizao
issues.summary: User requests a built-in error notification mechanism for workflow failures to integrate with external error tracking services like Bugsnag. The SDK maintainer recommends using interceptors instead and points to existing samples.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Update build-gems GH workflow smoke test to use macOS Intel
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The macOS Intel runner was removed from the build-gems workflow's smoke test because it cannot download the CLI due to outdated CA certificates. This feature request asks to update the workflow to support macOS Intel testing again.

issues.title: [Bug] Workflow handler *name* can only be applied to one handler
issues.author: stwomack
issues.summary: Ruby SDK does not allow multiple workflow handlers (signal, update, query) to share the same name, unlike other SDKs. This causes a RuntimeError when attempting to define handlers with identical names for different handler types.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add Summary to LocalActivityOptions
issues.author: yuandrew
issues.summary: Feature request to add a Summary field to LocalActivityOptions in the Ruby SDK, as referenced in the features repository issue.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support accessing raw last heartbeat details
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Users need access to raw heartbeat details on Activity::Info, potentially as a collection of RawValue objects, to support use cases like providing hints. The feature also requires making heartbeat_details lazy to avoid eager deserialization for users working with raw values.

issues.title: [Bug] Application error conversion is not properly defaulting type to unqualified class name
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The failure converter in the Ruby SDK is not properly defaulting the error type to an unqualified class name. The issue points to a specific line in the code that needs to extract only the class name without the module namespace.

issues.title: [Bug] Do not drop namespace from activity/workflow name
issues.author: laurynas
issues.summary: Ruby SDK drops namespace from activity and workflow class names by default, causing potential naming collisions when the same class name is used in different namespaces. The issue was resolved by design decision to maintain compatibility with other SDKs and CLI/UI clarity.

issues.title: [Bug] Potential issue using runtime Sorbet and handlers
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Sorbet type checker is creating duplicate singleton methods on Temporal workflow definition classes, causing a RuntimeError. The issue occurs when using Sorbet runtime decorators on handler methods, and has been resolved in recent Sorbet releases.

issues.title: [Bug] Child invoked via #execute_child_workflow don't show up in parent relationship or UI
issues.author: 1990eam
issues.summary: Child workflows invoked via execute_child_workflow don't display as relationships in the parent workflow or dashboard UI, despite running and completing. They only appear in the parent's execution history.

issues.title: [Bug] temporalio_bridge error when installing gem
issues.author: dipth
issues.summary: The temporalio Ruby gem fails to install from source in Docker on aarch64-linux due to Cargo manifest issues with the temporalio_bridge library. The issue occurs despite the correct platform being available, suggesting a dependency resolution problem.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support single-page fetching for list workflows
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for single-page fetching in list workflows API. Currently the enumerable doesn't allow providing a next page token to fetch subsequent pages on demand; the request is to add a dedicated single-page method to enable manual pagination control.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Environment Configuration
issues.author: THardy98
issues.summary: Feature request to implement environment configuration for the Ruby SDK, following the pattern established in the features repository and the external client configuration proposal.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Provide last result and last failure to workflows
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to provide access to the last result and last failure information in workflows, allowing workflows to retrieve historical execution outcomes from previous runs.

issues.title: [Bug] Improperly accessing current activity context in outbound heartbeat
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Activity outbound heartbeat implementation incorrectly accesses the current activity context to get task token and activity info. This is problematic because heartbeat may be happening in a different thread/fiber, leading to potential race conditions or incorrect context access.

issues.title: [Bug] Improper enum value comparison on workflow update
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Ruby SDK incorrectly compares workflow update stage enum as integer instead of symbol, causing ArgumentError. The comparison needs to resolve the protobuf enum value before comparison.

issues.title: [Bug] Test env does not return result of workflow with child workflow
issues.author: dimroc
issues.summary: Test environment returns nil for workflow results when child workflows are executed within futures, with suspected race condition causing intermittent failures.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Investigate, document, and validate fork behavior
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to investigate and validate fork behavior in Ruby SDK. Core-based SDK objects cannot be used across forks, requiring documentation and validation that Temporal objects and clients are not reused post-fork, with consideration for eager runtime/client PID validation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Time#iso8601 improperly considered illegal, look into excluding
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Time#iso8601 method is incorrectly flagged as an illegal call in workflows due to internal calls that access current time. The SDK needs a more sophisticated illegal call detection system that can skip checking based on call stack context, and also support Time#initialize with deterministic parameters.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support "hints" for payload conversion
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for payload conversion hints in the Ruby SDK, allowing developers to specify type information for deserialization of activity/workflow inputs and outputs, signals, queries, and updates.

issues.title: [Ruby] Worker Versioning high level client
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Create a high-level client for Ruby SDK to manage worker deployments and control plane operations, following patterns established in the Go SDK implementation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Investigate `test_metric_basics` flake
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Intermittent test failure in test_metric_basics where expected metric count of 1 was receiving 2 instead. Root cause identified as OpenTelemetry metrics issue with incorrect attributes in Prometheus output.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Clarify in README issue with lazy loading during rails when testing workflows
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Rails lazy loading during development and testing causes IO errors in workflows because activity classes are lazily loaded, violating Temporal's no-IO-in-workflow constraint. Documentation is needed to clarify how to configure Rails to handle this safely, similar to existing Single-Table Inheritance guidance.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Investigate `test_queue` flake
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Test flake in test_queue where first workflow can complete before the second starts, causing assertion failures on workflow IDs. Issue appears resolved after Core upgrade but may recur.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Use exception full message for workflow/activity task logs
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to use exception full messages (including stack traces) in workflow and activity task failure logs instead of just logging the exception object. This would improve debugging visibility.

issues.title: [Bug] auto_time_skipping_disabled not resuming after block exit
issues.author: igillis-clara
issues.summary: The `auto_time_skipping_disabled` method in the Ruby SDK test framework incorrectly disables auto time skipping after exiting the block, causing tests to timeout when attempting to resume normal time progression after the block completes.

issues.title: [Bug] Workflow info start time should be the workflow start time not the first task start time
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Workflow info start time in Ruby SDK should reflect the workflow's actual start time, not the first task's start time. This is a breaking change opportunity for Ruby since it hasn't reached GA yet.

issues.title: [ruby] SDK support for activity reset
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Ruby SDK needs support for activity reset functionality, similar to what's available in other Temporal SDKs. This feature is partially implemented in PR #283 but requires a released dev server and test confirmation before being marked complete.

issues.title: [Bug] Unregistered Local Activity should fail Workflow Task
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Unregistered local activities should cause workflow task failure in Ruby SDK. This is a bug where the SDK is not properly validating and failing when an unregistered local activity is invoked.

issues.title: [Bug] OpenTelemetry using wrong timestamps causing it to fail with OTLP
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: OpenTelemetry integration is using incorrect timestamp conversion to nanoseconds, causing failures with OTLP. The fix requires using Time objects directly from Temporalio::Workflow.now instead of converting to nanos.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow implicit durable timers to be disabled
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add a way to disable implicit durable timers in Ruby SDK workflows, particularly for use with OpenTelemetry simple span processors that need non-durable timeouts. Implementation requires `Temporalio::Workflow::Unsafe.implicit_durable_timers_disabled` helper and integration with OTel span creation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Warn when the server-provided task start time is fairly different than time SDK begins processing the task
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to warn when the server-provided task start time differs significantly from when the SDK begins processing the task. Request was declined as too niche.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Show retry policy on activity info
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to display the retry policy on activity information in the Ruby SDK, referenced from a cross-SDK features issue.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Rails Integration
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to evaluate explicit Rails integration/gem for the Ruby SDK, including Rails config/DI, code generation, ActiveJob integration, and ActiveModel/ActiveRecord support. After research and sample development, the team concluded there isn't enough substantial Rails-specific integration needed to justify an explicit gem beyond documentation and samples.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Apply application failure logging and metrics behaviour according to `ApplicationErrorCategory`
issues.author: THardy98
issues.summary: Ruby SDK needs to implement application failure logging and metrics behavior according to ApplicationErrorCategory. This requires waiting for core SDK implementation to provide the necessary foundation.

issues.title: Heartbeating activities should be interrupted when the activities are paused.
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Activities that are paused should have their heartbeating interrupted to prevent unnecessary heartbeat signals while activities are suspended.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow use of io_wait-based fiber calls
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Allow io_wait-based fiber calls within a special unsafe context in the Ruby SDK. Currently blocked by a TODO, this feature would enable controlled I/O operations in workflows similar to the existing illegal_call_tracing_disabled helper.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Serialization context for codecs and converters
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add serialization context support for codecs and converters in the Ruby SDK, aligned with cross-SDK effort to standardize this capability including Nexus support.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support New Worker Versioning API
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: Add support for the new Worker Versioning API in the Ruby SDK through workflow annotations. This involves implementing design specifications documented in a cross-SDK design document, with Go SDK as the reference implementation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Sagas
issues.author: blaineventurine
issues.summary: Feature request to add saga pattern implementation to the Ruby SDK, similar to other Temporal SDKs. The maintainers declined, explaining that sagas are a pattern rather than a utility, and different use cases require different approaches.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Simple nightly smoke benchmark
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add a nightly smoke benchmark test for the Ruby SDK to ensure high performance remains stable, similar to existing benchmarks in the Python and .NET SDKs.

issues.title: Initial Nexus implementation - Ruby
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Implement Nexus support in the Temporal Ruby SDK following the feature specification defined in the cross-repository Nexus initiative.

issues.title: Please do a point release with the relaxing of the protobuf version
issues.author: njaremko
issues.summary: User requests a point release of the Ruby SDK with relaxed protobuf version constraints that were merged weeks ago but not yet published to RubyGems. The published version is missing this fix, forcing users to build from source.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Custom metric bucket sizes
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for custom metric bucket sizes in the Ruby SDK by exposing histogram bucket overrides that were made available in sdk-core.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose root workflow execution
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to expose root workflow execution in the Ruby SDK, pending implementation of core SDK functionality and features specification.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Document and validate that keyword args are disallowed in certain contexts
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add documentation and validation to disallow keyword arguments in activities, workflows, signals, queries, and updates, ensuring consistency with Temporal's positional-only parameter model across all SDKs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Custom slot supplier
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to implement custom slot suppliers in the Ruby SDK, similar to the existing Python implementation. This feature would allow users to provide custom logic for managing worker slot allocation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Built-in query responses should use "RawValue"
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to ensure built-in query responses in the Ruby SDK use "RawValue" format, aligning with the cross-SDK features specification.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Test randomness seed update over reset
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add a test to verify that workflows using randomness produce different values after reset-point resets. The test should run a workflow with random inputs to activities, reset at a midpoint, and confirm that pre-reset values remain the same while post-reset values differ.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support buildable source gem
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for building the Ruby SDK from source during gem installation. Currently the source gem doesn't work, but the SDK could include necessary sdk-core components to enable building on `gem install --platform ruby` for users in obscure environments where pre-built gems aren't available.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support user metadata
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for user metadata on workflows, activities, and timers in the Ruby SDK. This includes accepting optional static summary and details parameters when starting workflows, creating activities and timers, and implementing the __temporal_workflow_metadata query handler.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Build musl gem
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to build and distribute musl-compatible gem for Ruby SDK to support Alpine Linux and other musl-based distributions.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Host Ruby docs at ruby.temporal.io
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Publish Ruby SDK documentation to ruby.temporal.io instead of relying on rubydoc.info, which is experiencing issues. This aligns Ruby docs hosting with other Temporal SDKs (dotnet, python, typescript) and clarifies the canonical documentation location.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support Priority Annotations
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Feature request to add support for attaching priority to workflows and activities in the Ruby SDK, similar to capabilities being implemented across Temporal SDKs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add explicit memoization support to the`patched()` API
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Add explicit memoization support to the patched() API by introducing a `memoized` argument and delegating handling to Core for improved workflow behavior.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add `required_ruby_version >= 3.2.0` back to gemspec
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add Ruby version requirement (>= 3.2.0) back to the gemspec now that rake-compiler-dock dependency issue is resolved.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Accept search attributes in dev server startup
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Allow setting search attributes in dev server startup options for the Ruby SDK, translating them to --search-attribute CLI calls to align with recent CLI improvements.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow customization of dev server UI port
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to allow customization of the development server UI port in the Ruby SDK, with reference to a cross-SDK features discussion.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Contributing Guide
issues.author: MikePresman
issues.summary: Contributor requests a contributing guide for the Ruby SDK to understand how to build and contribute to the project. The maintainer indicates that development instructions exist in the README but suggests joining Slack for further guidance and points to the samples-ruby repository for contribution opportunities.

issues.title: [Feature Request] OTel metrics over HTTP
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to expose the ability to configure OTel metrics to use HTTP instead of the default gRPC protocol in the Ruby SDK. This aligns with a similar enhancement being considered for the Core library.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Special behavior for Temporal built-in prefixes
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to implement special behavior for Temporal built-in prefixes in the Ruby SDK, aligning with cross-SDK standards defined in the features repository.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Remove Go from test pipeline
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Remove Go dependency from Ruby SDK's test pipeline. The Ruby SDK can now write the 'kitchen sink' workflow entirely in Ruby, eliminating the need for Go.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Deadlock detection - improve interruption and stack trace
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Improve deadlock detection by interrupting deadlocked workflows post-eviction and providing the deadlocked thread's stack trace instead of the raise point stack trace.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Ensure signal buffer properly drained when dynamic signal added
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Ensure the signal buffer is properly drained when a dynamic signal is added to a workflow. This addresses a TODO item from issue #183 related to signal handling.

issues.title: [Feature Request] OpenTelemetry tracing
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Ruby SDK needs full OpenTelemetry tracing support to match capabilities available in other Temporal SDKs. This is a feature request to implement comprehensive OTel integration for distributed tracing.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Signal-with-start and update-with-start
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add three new client methods for signal-with-start and update-with-start workflows in Ruby SDK, aligning with the design pattern used in Python and .NET SDKs. This includes signal_with_start_workflow, start_update_with_start_workflow, and execute_update_with_start_workflow methods.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Workflow replayer
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to implement a workflow replayer for the Ruby SDK with capabilities to stream histories, similar to existing implementations in Python and .NET SDKs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose replay-safe metric meter from workflows
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to expose a replay-safe metric meter from Ruby workflows, similar to Python and .NET SDKs, to allow recording metrics inside workflow code.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Warn on unawaited workflow futures with failures
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to warn Ruby developers when workflow futures that have failed are never awaited, similar to existing Java SDK behavior. Could also warn on any unawaited futures regardless of failure status.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Ractor-based sandboxing
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Evaluate and potentially implement Ractor-based sandboxing for Ruby SDK workflows. The main blocker is Google::Protobuf incompatibility with Ractors, which would require implementing a custom Protobuf solution.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Drop Ruby 3.1 support, add Ruby 3.4 support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to drop Ruby 3.1 support and add Ruby 3.4 support, enabling the use of Ruby's `Data` class instead of `Struct` in the SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Provide client from activity context
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Allow users to access a Temporal client instance from within an activity context. Currently, there's no direct way to get the client from Activity::Context, which users need for various operations within activities.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Access to workflow/activity instance from context
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to expose workflow and activity instances through class methods for easier access from context. Workflows should be accessible via `Temporalio::Workflow.instance` and activities via `Temporalio::Activity::Context#instance`.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Provide "workflow local"
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add workflow-local storage capability to Ruby SDK, allowing users to store and retrieve data scoped to the current workflow execution. Request sketches using `Workflow["myValue"]` syntax similar to thread-local and fiber-local variables.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Buffered metrics for user use
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add buffered metrics support to the Ruby SDK, similar to the Python SDK implementation, allowing users to provide a metric buffer to the runtime as an alternative to OTel and Prometheus.

issues.title: [Bug] Windows CI segfaulting during tests
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Windows CI tests are segfaulting during execution. Backtraces indicate the issue occurs within the Rust bridge's parking_lot mutex locking mechanism, which appears to be calling Ruby's rb_w32_Sleep from a non-Ruby thread, causing NULL pointer dereference.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Metric meter implementation
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request for a metric meter abstraction in the Ruby SDK that can be accessed from the runtime, activities, and workflows for collecting and reporting application metrics.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Client RPC call cancellation
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to allow users to set a Temporalio::Cancellation for client RPC calls in the Ruby SDK, enabling cancellation of in-flight client operations.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Activity test environment
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Need activity test environment for Ruby SDK that can capture heartbeats, inject cancellation, and mock activity info during testing.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Dynamic activities
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to support dynamic activities in the Ruby SDK, allowing activities to be defined and executed dynamically at runtime rather than requiring static registration.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Worker client replacement
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to enable replacement of the client on a live worker in the Ruby SDK. Currently, workers cannot update their client configuration at runtime without stopping and restarting.

issues.title: [Feature Request] API key and RPC metadata setter
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to enable setting API key and RPC metadata on the live Temporal Ruby client, allowing users to configure authentication and metadata for RPC calls.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Schedule client
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request for a full-featured schedule client in the Ruby SDK to enable users to create, manage, and execute scheduled workflows.

issues.title: Investigate issue with Ruby 3.1/3.2 and worker fibers
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Fiber-based workers hang in Ruby 3.1/3.2 when Queue.push is called from a separate thread, but work correctly in Ruby 3.3+. The issue appears related to changes in Ruby's M:N scheduling model, preventing fibers waiting on queue.pop() from being woken up by pushes from other threads.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Scaffolding and bare-bones client
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Initialize Ruby SDK with scaffolding, bare-bones client for starting/executing workflows, and Ruby/Rust bridge. Excludes full RBS signatures, complete gRPC service set, and advanced features like payload codecs.

issues.title: Workflow update support
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request to add workflow update support to the Ruby SDK, enabling dynamic workflow code updates without losing workflow state.

issues.title: Worker versioning support
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request for worker versioning support in the Ruby SDK. This issue was closed as it applied to a previous version of the SDK that is no longer applicable following the SDK's rewrite and refresh.

issues.title: [Bug] RBS files are not included in released Gem
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: RBS type definition files in the sig/ directory are not included in the released Ruby gem, causing Steep type checking to fail with an UnknownLibraryError when users try to use the temporalio gem.

issues.title: [Bug] Release assets bear incorrect version number
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Release assets are incorrectly named with Bridge version number (0.0.1) instead of the actual SDK release version. The version in Bridge's Cargo.toml file needs to be updated during pre-release commits.

issues.title: Issue with using Temporal ruby-sdk
issues.author: RondaPriyatham
issues.summary: User encounters build error when trying to use temporalio gem with Ruby 3.0.4 and Rust 1.68.0. The error appears to be related to gem installation or compilation, and the user notes that some documentation still refers to the old 'temporal' package name instead of 'temporalio'.

issues.title: temporal-sdk-core-api-0.1.0: 3 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.1)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Three transitive dependencies in the Rust bridge have known vulnerabilities: a critical TOCTOU race condition in remove_dir_all (9.1 CVSS), and two high-severity issues in webpki and hyper affecting certificate verification and HTTP/2 handling. However, this issue was applicable to a previous SDK version and is no longer relevant after the SDK rewrite.
